isis.stitle: CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 2000, 4000, 7000, AND 8000 SERIES - REPLACEMENT

step1.para: Disconnect the clutch pedal return spring ( Figure 4).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. PEDAL SPACER (WITH AIR BRAKES), BRAKE PEDAL (WITH HYDRAULIC BRAKES)
9. CLEVIS PIN (3/8 x 1.0625), COTTER PIN (3/32 x 1.25)

step1.para: Disconnect the clutch pedal from the upper clutch rod by removing the cotter pin and clevis pin.
Disconnect the brake pedal return spring (where used).
Disconnect the brake pedal from the brake cylinder rod (where used).
Remove the pedal shaft bolt lock nut.
Remove the pedal shaft bolt, the clutch pedal (with bushings), the brake pedal (with bushings) or pedal spacer and spacer tube from the steering column support bracket.
Discard the old bushings. Inspect the spacer tube, the clutch, and brake pedal bores for wear. Replace if worn or damaged. Replace clevis pins if worn.
Lubricate the inside and outside of new bushings with a light coat of grease. Use Fleetrite EP2 grease or an equivalent NLGI #2 multi-purpose lithium grease.
Position the spacer tube and bushings in bore(s) of pedal(s).
Position the clutch pedal (with bushings), brake pedal (with bushings) or pedal spacer and spacer tube into the steering column support bracket and install the pedal shaft bolt and lock nut.
Tighten the pedal shaft lock nut to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 N•m). Be sure pedals pivot freely after tightening the lock nut.
Connect the brake pedal to brake cylinder rod (where used). Adjust the brake pedal free travel if necessary.
Connect the brake pedal return spring (where used).
Connect the clutch pedal to the upper clutch rod and install a new cotter pin. Lubricate the clevis pin with a light coat of grease.
Connect the clutch pedal return spring.
Check the clutch control adjustments and readjust as needed.
